1 Edmund Husserl, Ideas for a Pure Phenomenology and Phenomenological Philosophy. Daniel Dahlstrom, trans. Hackett Publishing, 2014. Paper 9781624661266. $30

2 Martin Heidegger, Being and Time. John Macquarrie  Edward Robinson, trans. Harper Reprint, 2008. 9780061575594. $17. This is a relatively recent, lowercost edition of the classic translation by MR. You might find an older edition of their translation somewhere, most likely used. Thats fine. Just make sure its another edition of their translation. All that said, given the reasonable cost and easy accessibility of this new edition, it probably makes sense to just go for this edition.

3 Martin Heidegger, Basic Problems of Phenomenology. Albert Hofstadter, trans. Indiana Univ. Press, 1988. 9780253204783. $28. Dont mistakenly get a book with the same title with an additional subtitle Winter Semester 191920 and a different translator and press, which is also much more expensive. Thats a translation of a different text than ours. They both stem from a course that Heidegger gave with the same title. The one we want which has only been translated by AH and put out by Indiana UP is from a lecture in 1927.
